channel.title: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?
channel.description:
My system has the following specifications
* QT Wallet 2.0.0.1 * Windows 10 * I’m not sure how to find block # of your client and # of connections
The problem I am having is I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?

item.title: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Okay, just to double check, what version you are now seeing after the update?
Also, do you see your correct address(s) under the “Receive” tab?

Read full topic

item.source: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?

item.title: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Okay, your funds are safe as long as you still have your original wallet.dat file. If your coins haven’t showed up after updating, you might just need to do a rescan for the wallet to show the inputs.

Here are directions on how to rescan:

How to rescan within the BitBay QT Wallet (PC) Get Started Guides
Initiating a “rescan” will allow your wallet to update your address’s history of inputs, possibly correcting any issues with your total coin balance. PC: Follow these steps to initiate a “rescan” on PC: 1. Right click the QT app and select “Create shortcut”. [Create%20a%20shortcut] 2. Drag the newly created shortcut to your Desktop (to keep separate from parent app) [Drag%20the%20shurtcut%20to%20your%20Desktop%20just%20to%20seperate%20them] 3. Right click the new shortcut and click on “Prope…

If this doesn’t work, let me know and we’ll go from there.

Read full topic
item.source: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?

item.title: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?
item.dc:creator: @truetrue sim
item.description:
@truetrue wrote:

tradersnow:

that you update your QT Wallet to get back on the correct fork. Here are instructions on how to do so:

I’ve followed these instructions and fully resinced and my ballance is showing 0. Please help!

Read full topic
item.source: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?

item.title: I haven't logged into my BitBay wallet in over a year. Does this mean I've lost my tokens to the hard fork?
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

truetrue:

specifications

You haven’t lost any coins. However it is mandatory that you update your QT Wallet to get back on the correct fork. Here are instructions on how to do so:

How to fix the chain split issue on Qt wallet (**MANDATORY FOR USERS**) Support
Please complete the following steps to download and install the new bootstrap and QT wallet. It is necessary to follow the steps in the correct order. Back up your “wallet.dat” and “BitBay” folder before moving to step two. Depending on your operating system, the BitBay data folder can be found in these locations: Windows users: users/“yourusername”/appdata/roaming/Bitbay folder (make sure you have “show hidden files” selected) Mac users: ~/Library > Application Support > BitBay Linux…

If you have any questions on getting through the process, let us know. Thank you.

Read full topic
